p: The monoterpene hydrocarbonss were the second dominant components in the three cardamom varieties and represent 36.9% in the green cardamom essential oil, followed respectively by the black cardamom (34.2%) and the Ethiopian cardamom (24.7%). The second class of components is dominated by Î±-terpinyl acetate (28.6%) in green cardamom essential oil, 4-terpineol for the Ethiopian cardamom (10.4%), and geraniol (12.5%) in the essential oil of black cardamom.
